headline: Great work life balance, but slow
pros: Great work life balance, people are nice
cons: Slow, not cutting edge technology

headline: Decent pay but bad culture
pros:
Flexible schedule in some departments
Lots of opportunities in different positions and departments
Good benefits
cons:
Everyone is replaceable mentality
Regular layoffs so no job security
Company cares about numbers not people

headline: Constantly going through growing pains.
pros: Innovation and creative autonomy are encouraged.
cons: Executive leadership kicks the proverbial can down the road when it comes to addressing resource and structural needs raised by lower level management. When resources are finally aligned for success, they're poached by other executive leaders for their own pet projects without regard for the negative impact it'll cause to the area they're poaching from. This results in a stressful environment being a daily normal rather than the occasional exception.

headline: good and bad
pros: there were some talent people in the group and project has been designed well
cons: benefit is bad before bought by Aetna

headline: Only cares for their bottom dollar
pros: They gave us pizza once
cons: They lure you in with promises of hiring you in from a temp position and then give absolutely no date by which you would become a full employee.

headline: Great company
pros: Great company to work for with great IT management team that support individuals to grow.
cons: No cutting edge technology, can embrace more innovation

headline: Average
pros: Benefits are comparable to most
cons: Advancement is very slow to reach

headline: Non Competitive wages
pros: Ability to find another job at Aetna
cons: Sr Management is weak and self serving

headline: Analyst
pros: Very flexible, two work from home days a week.
cons: Not much for raises.

headline: Review Title
pros: Able to wear casual clothes; some flexibility is setting work schedule; sometimes possible to work from  home.
cons: Jobs being sent to India and the Philippines, as Aetna tries to cut costs.  American workers losing those jobs, along with the expertise that made the company run smoothly.

headline: Claims Department - Worst Ever
pros: Customer Services department tried there best to resolve the issues but even they didnt had any luck
cons: Unfortunately i have to give one star but the claims department sucks. Bunch of illiterate and drunk people are processing the claims. Sorry for the language but without any reason they kept on rejecting multiple claims and will never provide correct reason. Customer service doesnt even have access to the actual reason and then they try their best to explain and keep customer happy. I have to submit same claim 4 times and still didnt got processed. Called 5 times for it and still no result. Customer service kept on raising tickets but no result still.

headline: Yuck!
pros:
Got a Paycheck
Had a lunch break
cons:
Management DID NOT CARE about the customers or the employees
Horrible place to work - did not provide training
Would try to pass customers around rather then just get them the answer

headline: Overall lacks diversity and team environment
pros: PayFlex is a subsidiary of Aetna, so you have good benefits.
cons:
This is a female dominated organization at all levels and no cultural diversity in the workforce.  Is anyone in HR looking at the stats?
There is favoritism, double-talk and double standards.  I would even say some treatment of employees is unethical - not at all up to Aetna cultural standards.

headline: Claims review of the job
pros: Meet great people and I liked the benefits.
cons: Not a lot of on going training

headline: In My Experience
pros: Co-workers, Aetna policies and benefits are a plus
cons: Office politics, favoritism, Work life balance

headline: Senior Developer
pros: Great Working Environment;Respectful; High Technology;
cons: I do not see cons at this point

headline: It was okay
pros: Call volume low. Love that
cons: Training contained all of material given to you at once.

headline: Escalations Supervisor
pros: Good management.  During the peak busy times they will supply breakfast, snacks, or lunch
cons: During peak busy times the calls are constant back to back and getting time off is very difficult

headline: They do not properly train employees before putting on the job; thus resulting in bad service, wrong information.
pros: Trainers are very nice, but are put on such a time crunch that they do not have time to properly train employees.
cons: Poor system.  Unorganized,, poorly trained employees.  They start employees that they hire from a staffing service and  they start them on the  job before they are trained properly.  They give employees a crash course on a million things and start them to work.  In essence, the temporary employees are answering members questions when they aren't even sure of what they are doing.  Payflex has them put members on hold while trying to find the correct answer, resulting in members being on hold for so long that they often hang up.

headline: Ok, but needs better training
pros: Nice place, nice people except the schedulers.
cons: Too much information and product lines at once
